description:
Alternation (due to Christian) of Middle English uncristen, uncristene, from Old English uncristen (“unchristian”),
equivalent to un- +‎ Christian. Compare West Frisian onkristen, Dutch onkristen (obsolete Dutch onchristen), Danish ukristen, Swedish okristen, Icelandic ókristinn.

adjectives.description: unchristian (comparative more unchristian, superlative most unchristian)

entries.meaning: Not in accord with Christian principles; without Christian spirit; unbefitting a Christian.
examples: Arius  […]  eventually died obscurely, reputedly as the result of an acute attack of dysentery in a latrine in Constantinople, which circumstance afforded his enemies some unchristian pleasure, and was eventually commemorated with exemplary lack of charity in the Orthodox liturgy.
